channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A Timeline of the Legal Saga Surrounding SNAP Payments
item.description: Weeks of uncertainty during the longest government shutdown in American history have left some states struggling to issue payments to food stamp recip...

item.title: Maps: Tracking Typhoon Fung-wong
item.description: See the likely path and wind arrival times for Fung-wong

item.title: Russian Bombardment Causes Large Outages in Ukraine’s Big Cities
item.description: The attack by Russian missiles and drones targeted the capital, Kyiv, and the large cities of Dnipro and Kharkiv, as well as several smaller municipal...

item.title: Merck PCSK9 Pill Results Point to Extremely Low Cholesterol Future
item.description: The drug targets the PCSK9 protein, and could give millions of people a more affordable option to reduce their heart disease risk.

item.title: Gavin Newsom, Eyeing 2028, Tries to Mess With Texas
item.description: Celebrating his recent redistricting victory, the California governor swooped into a state led by a Republican rival and sent the latest signal about ...

item.title: Billionaire Peter Thiel warns if you ‘proletarianize the young people,’ don’t be surprised they end up communist
item.description: "Capitalism is not working for a lot of people in New York City. It’s not working for young people."

item.title: Heavy Rain Expected in California After Spell of Unusually Warm Weather
item.description: Areas across the state could record anywhere from one to five or more inches of rain. The Sierra will get some snow.

item.title: It’s not about inflation or the economy — the election instead delivered a ‘wake-up call’ on affordability politics, top pollster says
item.description: "But make no mistake, how much you pay at the cash register is going to determine who you vote for in these elections."

item.title: Trump signals no shutdown compromise on the Affordable Care Act, calling it ‘the worst Healthcare anywhere in the world’
item.description: Trump suggested Congress send money directly to people to buy health insurance.

item.title: Trump wants his name on the Washington Commanders’ planned $3.7 billion stadium, and he has ‘plenty of cards to play,’ report says
item.description: "He can make it very difficult, through government environmental approvals and other things, to make sure everyone who wants this stadium to be built ...

item.title: Trump keeps touting a Thanksgiving meal basket from Walmart that’s 25% cheaper. But it has half as many items as last year
item.description: This year's basket includes just 15 items compared to last year's 29. It is missing many dessert items, including a pecan pie, mini marshmallows and m...

item.title: Worries Increase on Second Day of Flight Cancellations
item.description: Disruptions to air travel on Saturday were modest, but officials and passengers were bracing for worse as the government shutdown continued.

item.title: Anthony Grey, Journalist Held Hostage by China for Two Years, Dies at 87
item.description: A correspondent for Reuters, he became a global symbol of China’s isolation and of the anti-foreigner hysteria spawned by its Cultural Revolution.

item.title: In Cozying Up to Trump, Leaders Hedge Their Reliance on Moscow and Beijing
item.description: President Trump has made it easier for countries that are close to Russia and China to build ties with the United States. Those countries are embracin...

item.title: Trump Gives Hungary a Reprieve on Sanctions After Meeting With Orban
